HTMLGeolocationElement.summary: NOTE Experimental The HTMLGeolocationElement interface of the HTML DOM API represents the geolocation element, and provides access to its properties and events.

remarks.para: This element is based on, and inherits properties and methods from, the interface.

blockquote.para: The <geolocation> element and HTMLGeolocationElement interface allow the user to share their location data with the page in a more consistent and intuitive way than the older Geolocation API.

remarks.para:
-geolocation element
-The Permissions-Policy/geolocation Permissions Policy
-Geolocation API
-Permissions API
-Introducing the <geolocation> HTML element on developer.chrome.com (2026)

HTMLGeolocationElementAutolocate.summary: NOTE Experimental The autolocate property of the interface gets and sets a boolean value indicating whether the browser should immediately request location data when the {{htmlelement("geolocation")}} element is rendered, provided permission to use the geolocation feature is already granted.

remarks.para: It reflects the value of the <geolocation> autolocate attribute.
-geolocation element

HTMLGeolocationElementAutolocate.value: A boolean value:Defaults to false.If permission to use the geolocation feature was not previously granted, the autolocate property is ignored.

HTMLGeolocationElementError.summary: NOTE Experimental The error read-only property of the interface returns a object representing error information, in the event of a failure to retrieve location data.

remarks.para: If location data retrieval is successful, the data is available in the property.
-geolocation element

HTMLGeolocationElementError.value: A object, or null if location data was successfully retrieved.

HTMLGeolocationElementHTMLGeolocationEle.summary: NOTE Experimental The HTMLGeolocationElement() constructor creates a new object instance.

remarks.para: -geolocation element

HTMLGeolocationElementHTMLGeolocationEle.returns: A new object instance, if used internally by the browser.Developers cannot use the HTMLGeolocationElement() constructor directly to create a new HTMLGeolocationElement instance: attempting to do so results in an "illegal constructor" error.

HTMLGeolocationElementInitialPermissionS.summary: NOTE Experimental The initialPermissionStatus read-only property of the interface returns an enumerated value representing the permission status for the geolocation feature when the page first loads.

remarks.para: If you want to access the current permission status for the geolocation feature, use the property.
-geolocation element

HTMLGeolocationElementInitialPermissionS.value: An enumerated value, which can be one of:

HTMLGeolocationElementInvalidReason.summary: NOTE Experimental The invalidReason read-only property of the interface returns an enumerated value representing the reason why the associated {{htmlelement("geolocation")}} element is invalid (blocked), if that is the case.

remarks.para: When a blocker is active on a <geolocation> element, it is invalid: This means that it is prevented from functioning, either temporarily or permanently, depending on the reason.
You can query the property to check whether the <geolocation> element is valid or not.
-geolocation element

HTMLGeolocationElementInvalidReason.value:
The empty string ("") if the element does not have an active blocker, or one of the following values (in priority order):These invalid reasons are listed in priority order, from highest to lowest.

HTMLGeolocationElementIsValid.summary: NOTE Experimental The isValid read-only property of the interface returns a boolean value indicating whether the associated {{htmlelement("geolocation")}} element is valid or invalid (blocked).

remarks.para: When a blocker is active on a <geolocation> element, it is prevented from functioning (invalid), either temporarily or permanently, depending on the reason.

HTMLGeolocationElementLocation.summary: NOTE Experimental The location event of the interface is fired whenever the browser receives location data, or error information when a location data request was unsuccessful.

remarks.para: -geolocation element

HTMLGeolocationElementPermissionStatus.summary: NOTE Experimental The permissionStatus read-only property of the interface returns an enumerated value representing the current permission status for the geolocation feature.

remarks.para: If you want to access the initial permission status for the geolocation feature as it was when the page first loaded, use the property.
-geolocation element

HTMLGeolocationElementPermissionStatus.value: An enumerated value, which can be one of:The permission status persists between page loads. If the <geolocation> element has its autolocate attribute set to true, and permission was previously granted, the browser will start to request location data as soon as the <geolocation> element renders without requiring the user to press the button.

HTMLGeolocationElementPosition.summary: NOTE Experimental The position read-only property of the interface returns a object representing the user's position, in the event of successful location data retrieval.

remarks.para: The retrieved position may or may not be up to date. The user's position will only be retrieved once when the <geolocation> element's button control is pressed, unless you set the watch attribute to true, in which case a new position will be retrieved each time the user's device moves. To read the user's current position, you should read the position property in response to the event firing.
If location data retrieval fails, associated error information will be available in the property.
-geolocation element

HTMLGeolocationElementPosition.value: A object, or null if location data retrieval failed or data has not yet been retrieved.

HTMLGeolocationElementPromptaction.summary: NOTE Experimental The promptaction event of the interface is fired whenever the user activates the <geolocation> element and selects an option from the resulting dialog, either to grant or deny geolocation permission.

remarks.para: -geolocation element

HTMLGeolocationElementPromptdismiss.summary: NOTE Experimental The promptdismiss event of the interface is fired whenever the user activates the <geolocation> element and dismisses the resulting dialog, by pressing the "close" button or the <kbd>Esc</kbd> key.

remarks.para: -geolocation element

HTMLGeolocationElementValidationstatusch.summary: NOTE Experimental The validationstatuschange event of the interface is fired whenever the {{htmlelement("geolocation")}} element's value changes.

remarks.para: This occurs as a result of a blocker being added to or removed from a <geolocation> element.
-geolocation element

HTMLGeolocationElementWatch.summary: NOTE Experimental The watch property of the interface gets and sets a boolean value indicating whether the browser should continuously update the user's location data whenever the position of their device changes, or only retrieve it once.

remarks.para: It reflects the value of the <geolocation> watch attribute.
-geolocation element
